H0.text: The Treaty of Fontainebleau, signed on 11 April 1814 by representatives of France, Austria, Hungary, Bohemia, Russia, and Prussia, had a marked effect on the personal life of whom. Louis XVIII

H1.text: The Treaty of Fontainebleau, signed on 11 April 1814 by representatives of France, Austria, Hungary, Bohemia, Russia, and Prussia, had a marked effect on the personal life of whom. Tsar Alexander I

H2.text: The Treaty of Fontainebleau, signed on 11 April 1814 by representatives of France, Austria, Hungary, Bohemia, Russia, and Prussia, had a marked effect on the personal life of whom. Francis II

H3.text: The Treaty of Fontainebleau, signed on 11 April 1814 by representatives of France, Austria, Hungary, Bohemia, Russia, and Prussia, had a marked effect on the personal life of whom. Napoleón

A4.text: The treaty also established the island of Elba as a separate principality to be ruled by Napoleon.

A5.text: Napoleon was stripped of his powers as ruler of the French Empire, but both Napoleon and Marie‑Louise were permitted to preserve their respective titles as emperor and empress.
